sentences: Teras on kõvem kui raud - Steel is harder than iron
See oli kõva pidu - That was a hell of a party
context: The Estonian word 'kõva' is highly versatile with multiple meanings depending on context. It can describe physical hardness of materials (like metal), firmness of structures or convictions, severity of punishments or weather, quality of things, strength of alcohol, loudness of sounds, and even personal characteristics. As an adjective, it has comparative form 'kõvem' (harder/more) and superlative 'kõige kõvem' or 'kõvim' (hardest/most). It's one of those words that Estonians use frequently in many different contexts.
